relation: Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Police are constantly patrolling campus. There is also a 24 hour number you can call. Comes in handy during one of those late nights at the library when you don't want to walk home by yourself.

Do it. You won't regret it. There are numerous fraternity and sororities on campus. At the beginning of the year they'll have socials so you can meet all of their actives. You're bound to fall in love with one of the sororities or fraternities.
There's a club for everyone. Anything from Nerf Club, to professional. If there isn't one you like you can make one.
Purple pancakes! Get pumped for homecoming!
There's a small movie theater and a bowling alley.

The food is better than most cafeteria food I've had. They always do really cool themed stuff. Sometimes they'll have a chocolate fountain during lunch, cupcake decorating contests, and salad and pasta bars. They have a selection for vegetarians and have a variety of foods.

I live on one of the oldest dorm on campus, but i wouldn't trade it for any other one. I know everyone in my hall and a lot of us are very close. It's always good to live in a dorm because there are people of all majors that can help you if you're struggling in a class.
Professor are always willing to help, they understand. There is also supplemental instruction (SI) for some classes. They're very helpful. The SI instructors also hold test prep sessions.
Get involved. You will hear that from everyone here at TSU. I have met so many new people.
pageTitle: Tarleton State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {371334=The Purple Poo evolved from the TTS/TTP spirit organizations. The still-secret organization gathers to make Poo Say signs each Monday night. The Poo Say signs appear on campus every Tuesday morning and occasionally comment on campus political life and student life. The Poo Say signs are nailed to the trees on campus and most are designed to promote school spirit. Purple Poo members appear in public dressed in costume to conceal their identity. Many members un-mask at the Leadership and Service Awards Ceremony each April while others choose to have their pictures appear in the Grassburr. At commencement, graduating members will pass a purple pig to the university president as they pass across the stage., 367252=Has amazing professors. Has a lot of country people and cowboys. May not be the best for people from the city., 78348=Apply early for the scholarship deadline, Dec. 1. Also, choose to be in a Learning Community., 200950=Beginning in Fall 2012, new Tarleton Texans emerged on campus a week before classes began (Aug. 19-26). Students moved into their residence halls on Aug. 19 and experienced a week full of activities designed to help them meet their academic and social objectives. The week also guided students through the resources available to adjust to Tarleton's environment and culture. Please take advantage of this week. It was very helpful., 435279=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}
textBeforeTable: 09/18/2009 Reviewer is A past student here. 16 out of 18 people found this review useful. 1 of 100 Laura from Dallas, TX Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. You could win a free scholarship. textAfterTable: Bang for the buck Tarleton's cheap tuition make it one of the best deals for education you'll be able to find. The environment, teachers, school spirit, and community feel makes it one of the best schools to go to and make the cost seem like a steal. I've made so many close friends within my first semester and learned so much in subjects I wasn't expecting to like and I've really enjoyed the whole experience. Am enjoying being here I love the campus and love the people I've met there. Being with people that are striving for a similar goal to your own really helps you concentrate and pull your grades to where you want them. There is also a lot of organizations and activities on campus that are a lot of fun to partake in. Am learning a lot There is a wealth of knowledge at Tarleton State University. There is a huge variety of classes ranging from mathematics courses to musical courses to theatre courses. There are honors programs available, which I am a part of. The teachers at Tarleton care about the individual student if that student cares about his or her education. I feel so much more intelligent just being on campus and interacting with others
